alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 12:27AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Jewell, eastern Smith and southern Webster Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1227 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bellaire, or 35 miles east of Phillipsburg, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lebanon around 1230 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Red Cloud and Cowles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
